In introducing the eleventh number of the NEW ENGLAND BUSINESS DIRECTory to the public, the publishers desire to call attention to some of its varied features, and reference to the Index to Contents will readily show where they may be found. Twenty-seven years ago the first number of this work was issued, from this office, and a comparison between that and the present massive volume shows the vast strides that have been made in the business of the six States. This is most noticeable in the cities, Boston, for instance, then occupying 39 pages and now 142; and many of the towns at that time almost unknown, are now flourishing cities, and make an extensive showing in the Business Directory. It has ever been our aim to give the information most needed in the counting room, office, and workshop, with clearness, fullness, and accuracy, avoiding confusion and repetition, and as experience has suggested improvements they have from time to time been incorporated in the work. The most noticeable new feature in the present issue is the GAZETTEER DEPARTMENT. This, used in connection with the Business Directory, or simply for reference, will be found invaluable. Attention is also directed to the statistics of the MANUFACTURING CoMPANIES, beginning at page 1549, which have been compiled with great care and labor, to make them as complete as possible. In consulting the Business Directory it must be borne in mind that all names under the headings are arranged by

and when a name or place cannot be found where expected, a glamce at the Gazetteer department may show that the place sought is located in a town bearing a very different name. For instance, the business of Turner's Falls, Mass., must be looked for under Moutague. This arrangement is made for the purpose of bringing all villages of the same town together, and is deemed more desirable than a strictly alphabetical arrangement of the towns, villages, and post offices. The Gazetteer gives all cities, towns, villages, post offices, etc., in an alphabetical list, by States, and under each town are given all the post offices located within its limits. The revision of this work has been thorough and complete. Changes have occurred during the time necessary for the careful compiling and printing of so large a volume, which it would have been desirable to incorporate in their proper places, but the latest information possible has been made use of. To the large number of patrons the publishers extend their warmest thanks, with the hope that the work will merit their approval. Any changes or corrections for the
next issue gladly received at the Directory office. SAMPSON, DAVENPORT,

In introducing the eleventh number of the NEW ENGLAND BUSINESS DIRECTory to the public, the publishers desire to call attention to some of its varied features, and reference to the Index to Contents will readily show where they may be found. Twenty-seven years ago the first number of this work was issued, from this office, and a comparison between that and the present massive volume shows the vast strides that have been made in the business of the six States. This is most noticeable in the cities, Boston, for instance, then occupying 39 pages and now 142; and many of the towns at that time almost unknown, are now flourishing cities, and make an extensive showing in the Business Directory. It has ever been our aim to give the information most needed in the counting room, office, and workshop, with clearness, fullness, and accuracy, avoiding confusion and repetition, and as experience has suggested improvements they have from time to time been incorporated in the work. The most noticeable new feature in the present issue is the GAZETTEER DEPARTMENT. This, used in connection with the Business Directory, or simply for reference, will be found invaluable. Attention is also directed to the statistics of the MANUFACTURING CoMPANIES, beginning at page 1549, which have been compiled with great care and labor, to make them as complete as possible. In consulting the Business Directory it must be borne in mind that all names under the headings are arranged by

and when a name or place cannot be found where expected, a glamce at the Gazetteer department may show that the place sought is located in a town bearing a very different name. For instance, the business of Turner's Falls, Mass., must be looked for under Moutague. This arrangement is made for the purpose of bringing all villages of the same town together, and is deemed more desirable than a strictly alphabetical arrangement of the towns, villages, and post offices. The Gazetteer gives all cities, towns, villages, post offices, etc., in an alphabetical list, by States, and under each town are given all the post offices located within its limits. The revision of this work has been thorough and complete. Changes have occurred during the time necessary for the careful compiling and printing of so large a volume, which it would have been desirable to incorporate in their proper places, but the latest information possible has been made use of. To the large number of patrons the publishers extend their warmest thanks, with the hope that the work will merit their approval. Any changes or corrections for the
next issue gladly received at the Directory office. SAMPSON, DAVENPORT,
